item.title:
RT by @gakonst: And by getting the most out of the L1, I think of things like:
How do I know when to publish updates and whether it should be to blob or call data? How do I tap into a shared sequencer to save L1 costs? How do I add a bridge deployment? How do I send a cross chain message? I’m running an L1 stack and have access to >32 ether, can I run a (distributed) validator easily in the same deployment to subsidise its cost?

item.title:
RT by @gakonst: Lots probably exist that I’m unaware of, but I think the user journey is:
“How do I dev on my reth-sdk L2 idea locally, running it with/on anvil, and then; how do I run it HA in prod with a diversity of setups while doing the least amount of grunt work to actually figure that out?”
I’m imaging the heroku like experience of build + deploy but for L2s (even better if this can work for ExEx ideas, more practical than spinning up a fresh L2 for a feature). Ideally you end up with an ecosystem of ExExs that the next wave of developers can add like crates to their new reth-sdk chain idea. (Staking, restaking, alt-da, indexers, etc)

what im going for:
- generate scoped session key in cloudflare worker
- pass the pubkey to the frontend to webauthn sign it and add it to your account using porto
- your cf worker is now able to do magic with your account securely
